My daughter loves Super Why on TV so I decided to get the DVD for the car.  Just beware of all the ads/commercial additions.  My impatient daughter wants her show immediately and it's dangerous when I have to use the remote while driving to pass through all the ads.

There are so many wonderful things to say about this DVD. First, you have the element of imagination as Whyatt and his friends transform from mere mortals into their super hero personas. They fly into books to look for the answers to the questions that will solve their problems. In addition, the show is interactive, with the characters addressing the audience and taking your child on the adventure with them. Your child will enjoy singing along and solving problems alongside the Super Readers, while learning important skills like identifying letters, spelling, and reading comprehension. As a writer, I love how Super Why! can change the story with his power to read. That helps kids realize the power of words.

Each episode opens with a summary of what the viewer will learn, so parents can see what will be focused on and supplement their child's learning. Extra features include fun song videos, four PC games, and coloring pages.

Super Why!: Around the World Adventure DVD is a great way to get your kids ready to read!
Just like the TV show, this Superwhy DVD is a quality movie and just what my son wanted.  Thank you very much!

My kids love Super Why, but this is the first time they've been introduced to the dictionary dog. The dog works into the cast of characters well and the stories incorporate his super power smoothly. Sometimes it's a bit annoying to hear the dog give a definition that isn't really a definition, just a description of what they're seeing, but of course my kids don't care. They really like hearing what new words mean and for some reason having it come from a dog makes it all the more appealing.

My 2.5 year old has a slight speech delay (previous ear problems) and this show has actually helped her with some of her missing sounds/words. I love that it breaks down sentence structure, letters and sounds. We don't have cable or even local channels where we live (100% static even with antennas) . So I kinda took a gamble. I am sooo glad we bought this DVD. We'll be buying more episodes.

My daughter loves Super Why. I love this DVD because it has the 'play all' feature unlike our 'Jack and the Beanstalk' one. I thought she just enjoyed watching it but she's truly been learning her letters from it. She's 4, nonverbal autistic, we were amazed when we asked her to pick a specific letter and she went through the entire alphabet after only watching episodes of Super Why for a week. This is why we only watch learning cartoons. I love how they highlight each letter as they say it. The puzzle is also a cute addition. She can now put it together as well. I'd definitely recommend this video.

I introduced this series to my kids because I had seen it a while back when I was watching other people's kids. This particular one was one the kids had not ever seen before and they ended up wanting to watch it over and over again.  We limit their tv time so this one is a good one for them to want during their allotted time!

I can feel better about letting my kids watch TV/movies if it is this show. Teaches kids how to spell, sound out letters and the alphabet. Also has a super hero aspect which makes reading/learning fun. Great for any youngster.

My son is a huge fan of Super Why.  He loves the adventures and likes the super heros.  Super Why is a great cartoon for kids - educational and positive, also it doesn't grate on your nerves like some of the others out there.

My son loves this show. He already knows his letters so we like to watch the show and call out the letters.  It's great for learning phonics as well.  We purchased a few of these DVDs for road trips. If you have an iPad, they sell entire seasons at a better value than the dvds and there's also a great game available.

My daughter loves this PBS show.  She was thrilled with the DVD so she could watch more than one episode at a time.  I think the length is just right.  She sings the theme song during each opening sequence.  She is autistic and I have been able to use her love of the show to get her into conversations about what is happening.  I have caught her twin brother and 7 year old older brother watching as well.  I love how the show encourages thinking about words and what makes sense to say or do in a story.  I am glad I bought this.
Was a great purchase glad I did it and would do it again, it was fast and easy and it came in the mail very quickly
